examples: Yet the game proliferated, and the 15th century saw it cohering into the form we know today.
words.defineEn: come or be in close contact with; stick or hold together and resist separation
words.defineVi: đến hoặc tiếp xúc gần với; dính hoặc giữ lại với nhau và chống lại sự tách rời

examples: The cohesive force of water does have its limits of course.
Cohesive bonds happen between a glue or tape’s own molecules, holding it together.
They may make choices for you as a whole cohesive group.
They may make choices for you as a whole cohesive group.
There’s no one cohesive story because there is no one group of indigenous Aboriginal peoples.
words.defineEn: causing cohesion
words.defineVi: gây ra sự gắn kết

examples: I forged the note and the teacher fell for it hook, line, and sinker.
We forged forward.
We forged forward.
As a candidate, Obama forged an alliance with the city's powerful progressive Jews.
But they could also forge weapons and wage war.
words.defineEn: to make something from a piece of metal object by heating it until it becomes soft and then beating it with a hammer
words.defineVi: để làm một cái gì đó từ một mảnh vật kim loại bằng cách nung nóng nó cho đến khi nó trở nên mềm và sau đó đập nó bằng búa

examples: And forgery is one of those crimes.
Forgery confirmed.
And forgery was believed to be a black crime.
Like Valyrian steel, the secrets of its forgery were lost to history forever.
Today, this age-old chemical compound may help scientists prevent forgery and even save lives.
words.defineEn: the criminal act of making a copy of a document, money, etc. to do something illegal
words.defineVi: hành vi phạm tội sao chép tài liệu, tiền, v.v. để làm điều gì đó bất hợp pháp

words.defineEn: what you must know in order to determine the reference of an expression
words.defineVi: những gì bạn phải biết để xác định tham chiếu của một biểu thức

examples: I do not doubt their good intentions, but a directive would be too much of a good thing.
If you pay close attention to people's behavior and actions, you can often predict their intentions, as a straw will show which way the wind blows.
He had the wrong perception of the situation and misunderstood the intentions.
It is not right to treat others with bad intentions.
They showed me the ropes for writing a letter of intention.
words.defineEn: something that one is aiming, wanting, or planning to do
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó mà một người đang nhắm tới, mong muốn, hoặc có kế hoạch để làm

words.defineEn: capable of or tending to change in form or quality or nature
words.defineVi: có khả năng hoặc có xu hướng thay đổi về hình thức, chất lượng hoặc tính chất

examples: Mutations are random changes in DNA.
Damage to these blood-making cells can create mutations in their genomes.
Mutations occur randomly in our DNA all the time.
Today, roughly 95% of northern Europeans have the mutation.
Well, the short answer is mutations.
words.defineEn: (biology) a change in the structure of the genes of an individual that causes them to develop different physical features
words.defineVi: (sinh học) sự thay đổi cấu trúc gen của một cá nhân khiến họ phát triển các đặc điểm thể chất khác nhau

examples: Millions were mutilated and traumatised.

In June 1889, Vincent van Gogh painted the view just before sunrise from the window of his room at the Saint-Paul-de-Mausole asylum in Saint-Rémy-de-Provence, where he'd admitted himself after mutilating his own ear in a psychotic episode.
The Who's lyricist and lead guitarist became known for his windmilling and mutilating his instruments.
Although the family was unharmed, some members of the royal circle, including the queen’s best friend, were violated, murdered, and mutilated.
This gave rise to many rituals intended to prevent the dead from rising, such as burying bodies with garlic or poppyseeds, as well as having them staked, burned, or mutilated.
words.defineEn: destroy or injure severely
words.defineVi: phá hủy hoặc làm tổn thương nghiêm trọng

words.defineEn: consisting of or characterized by or inciting to mutiny
words.defineVi: bao gồm hoặc đặc trưng bởi hoặc xúi giục binh biến

examples: There was virtually a mutiny in the military high command back in Moscow.
The conditions and Magellan’s no-nonsense discipline caused mutinies and other problems which Magellan also handled harshly, executing or marooning mutineering captains in the fleet.

In the first phase, called the February Revolution, because get this, it occurred in February, army mutinies and civil unrest forced the overthrow of the Romanov dynasty which had been in power in Russia since, like, forever, to use a proper historian term.
Only their general’s charisma and negotiating skills prevented wholesale mutiny.
A full-blown mutiny soon erupted, which Magellan crushed with unspeakable cruelty.
words.defineEn: open rebellion against constituted authority (especially by seamen or soldiers against their officers)
words.defineVi: mở cuộc nổi dậy chống lại chính quyền được thành lập (đặc biệt là bởi các thủy thủ hoặc binh lính chống lại các sĩ quan của họ)

examples: It ends signature verification.
One voter's verification is another voter's barrier.
So what are vaccine verifications exactly?

Got my verification code on my apple watch.
words.defineEn: the act of proving the truth or accuracy of something, typically by checking or examining evidence or documentation
words.defineVi: hành động chứng minh sự thật hoặc tính chính xác của một cái gì đó, thường bằng cách kiểm tra hoặc kiểm tra bằng chứng hoặc tài liệu

examples: He shared false information without verifying its accuracy.
We should search for a reliable source to verify the information.
Verify the account, Jono. -
Power cord verified.
I could verify the case.
words.defineEn: to examine the truth or accuracy of something
words.defineVi: để kiểm tra sự thật hoặc tính chính xác của một cái gì đó

examples: We experience reconnaissance missions and attacks against electrical companies every day.
An earlier reconnaissance mission had been abandoned because of high levels of radiation over the reactors.
Preparing for its involvement in World War Two, the United States government sent requests to 135 automakers for a quarter ton light reconnaissance vehicle.
In 1907, Julius Neubronner, a German pharmacist who used the birds to deliver medicine, invented a miniature pigeon camera, and this camera was used briefly in the war for aerial reconnaissance.
He wanted to admit that he had been a KGB agent in foreign reconnaissance.
words.defineEn: the act of reconnoitring (especially to gain information about an enemy or potential enemy)
words.defineVi: hành động điều tra lại (đặc biệt là để có được thông tin về kẻ thù hoặc kẻ thù tiềm năng)

examples: Other things that began to unfold from then on through the election, of course, were the instances of what I would call reconnoitering by the Russian intelligence services into state-level databases, primarily voter registration rolls, in many cases maintained by contractor by each of the states.
words.defineEn: explore, often with the goal of finding something or somebody
words.defineVi: khám phá, thường với mục tiêu tìm kiếm một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

words.defineEn: difficult to penetrate; incomprehensible to one of ordinary understanding or knowledge
words.defineVi: khó thâm nhập; không thể hiểu được đối với một người có hiểu biết hoặc kiến thức thông thường

words.defineEn: of or relating to fungi
words.defineVi: của hoặc liên quan đến nấm

examples: The presence of certain fungi, like Penicillium, is essential in the production of some types of cheese.
Whatever the reasons, these fungi pass an incredible amount of information between trees.
This fungus was penicillin.
Caterpillar fungus grows in the remote Tibetan Plateau in the Himalayan mountains.
Another example is Penicillium fungi.
words.defineEn: a plant-like organism that often grows on organic matter and has no flowers or leaves, such as moulds and mushrooms
words.defineVi: một sinh vật giống như thực vật thường phát triển trên chất hữu cơ và không có hoa hoặc lá, chẳng hạn như nấm mốc và nấm

words.defineEn: relating to someone who likes to talk much more than necessary
words.defineVi: liên quan đến một người thích nói nhiều hơn mức cần thiết

words.defineEn: the quality of being wordy and talkative
words.defineVi: chất lượng của việc dài dòng và nói nhiều
